7mgMByS31v-1MHMUbwNavQ.text: If you're in the neighborhood of the Paris casino, this is worth a stop to quench your thirst and hang out with company.   How to get there: The bar is located outside on the second floor at the Paris hotel. There is a set of stairs outside near the Paris valet circle/front entrance on the sidewalk near LVB. You'll see an archway to the Beer Park, go under the arch and up the stairs, where you'll find the park. There's also an elevator, which I believe you need to access inside of the casino.   The beer: This is the BUDWEISER beer park. They have plenty of beers on tap, but don't expect local microbrews, coors light, or any of Budweiser's big competition. You can scroll through the pics others have posted of the menu for a grasp of the beer offerings. They also offer mixed drinks & some bottled beers. Although nobody in our group was partaking in the mixed drinks, I watched the bartenders mix quite a few. They didn't appear to be heavy on the pour, but they weren't skimping either.   The atmosphere: We were here on a Saturday around 10pm and this place was happening. It was a good time, and I had a hard time wanting to leave. There was a DJ going, people playing Jenga, a connect four game, people dancing, etc. There are two round bars upstairs right next to each other, picnic tables, bar stools having LVB. While we were there, there were plenty of people, but you could still find a place to sit.   The service: The bartenders were fast making drinks, trying to serve everyone, but there was a bit of an attitude from one. Particularly when I tried to order a Coors Light and was reminded how this is a Bud bar.  We never actually saw a food or bar menu, so without looking at the taps I didn't know what was offered. Also, we were skipped a couple of times to others who had walked up after we'd already been waiting. It was probably a busy night for them, so the mediocre service is being overlooked a bit in this 5 star rating.   The food: sorry guys and gals- we didn't eat there. You'll have to figure it out on your own

VeGYUQTl8A4QFGMKUlOCnQ.text: Great place to watch sports. In the heart of the strip. Rooftop is amazing. Pretzel was off the chain!

uo7ktGX6_IsTf3pfTexsqg.text: Nice place , but got told to move from the stairs and stop taking pic when it was pretty empty by security that had nothing to do ...

XXzqgUU07V0YolWengH3AA.text: I really liked the concept of beer park. I came here on a Saturday afternoon so it wasn't really poppin. I did like the chill laid back vibes tho. It had misters which really helped with the 105 degree temps outside lol. All the drinks are served in a porcelain like red solo cup. There are backyard games like jenga and connect four which is pretty awesome. They also show ufc fights here which was pretty cool. It's definitely a chill spot to go if you want to relax. The view is amazing, you can see the Bellagio fountains. All in all a good time, but kinda dead. Maybe it was the time of day??? The heat?? Idk it's a good place to check out, chill, and drink a brew. Cheers

FXydsw1JbVkSUOA-GUQoZw.text: We went on Saturday at noon with about 40 people including about 15 kids . We had a great seating with a view LV Blvd. This place could not have been more accommodating .they got us Extra chairs let everyone split the bill and ran food to all our guests all ordering randomly .and they never missed a beat and as I said we had at least 15 young kids running around and I never saw one server or food runner even make a face about our wild bunch . We had one main server EBONY she amazingly handled the whole group food on time drinks on time WOW !!!! Smiling the whole time . The food was great ! American bar food at its best  Get the TATER TOTS!!! Large beer selection and full bar with specialty drinks !!! Pool tables large Jenga really cool ... Def recommend this place . And with tons of TVs great for sports ..

The selection of craft beer was interesting, and after farther review we realized all the beer (or at least 99%) is owned by Budweiser, and this is a Budweiser establishment.  So my one complaint is this:  If you own/produce all the beer your selling, why am I paying $8-$22+ per beer?  Oh right....I'm paying for the view!

ddSMrfy_CYHRrLhfoUUOKg.text: This place is pretty amazing!! One of the coolest bar vibes I've experienced here in town. The views, the staff, food and drinks of course, and the overall hip feeling doesn't compare!! Can't wait to be there for the Super Bowl game!!

-8Ay3yEoBenRSdMnBEF-4A.text: I was lucky enough to attend the Beer Park's soft open. Even without serving their full menu they had a great selection of food to choose from and the beer and drink list is even greater. The prices are very cheap compared to food anywhere else. The beef brisket was delicious as well as their ribs! Cannot wait to come back and try out their full menu and see everything that they have to offer. The cherry on top would be the great view of the Las Vegas Strip as well as the Bellagio Fountains!

YGaeNzoxhUjvkDs17QfO6A.text: Fun space with outdoor games! I loved the space, the view of Bellagio's fountains, the numerous beers on draft and the Gilroy garlic fries! The staff is super friendly and efficient.

gvHxOEGwN7cF67BZ6SCHjw.text: If I could leave zero stars, I would. Went here on a Tuesday night around 9pm. There was no wait and we were seated immediately. So began problem number one: seated at bar like area facing bellagio fountains and you can't even see the fountains. I could care less about that as I'm a local but I know the market the beer park as having a view of the fountains. The "view" is so obstructed with trees, I could get better entertainment from my lawn sprinklers. Next fail: the actual chairs at this s seating. They are narrow to say the least and both myself and my boyfriend almost tipped them at 2 times each. I'm not a big girl either. 5'2" and 125lbs. So if you were thinking I may have tipped because  fat, that's not the case. Lastly, the service sucked. We sat for 12 mins without even an offer for a glass of water. This was while there were what seemed to be 4 hostesses standing around and ONE server for entire restaurant area. Boo on you BEER PARK. Huge disappointment.

dYmFNhy5T2ejjMmbXA0VlA.text: Okay first of all.... lol I LOVE BEER PARK because of Allan... & my booski Natasha I'm from Texas and I always come here by myself to check out my Dallas Cowboys or My Lakers! bWoAq2m7UnhaqqP7dpZYLA.text: Terrible service and mediocre food. Not worth the stop. I wish I could find anything positive to say about this place, but it was our worst experience in Vegas.

Q6hf1Q_chUQPss0wwx7Vbg.text: 3 stars for the service.   Came here to meet some friends for drinks. The space itself is great. Plenty of seating and an awesome view of the Strip. Specifically the Bellagio fountains. Lots of TVs as well with multiple sports on.   Beer selection is pretty big. Only a few selections of cider (not a beer fan), but I'm also a lightweight so 1-2 drinks is all I can handle anyway. We ordered the chips and guacamole and a pretzel. Both were pretty tasty.  The only hang up was the service. It took forever to get our drinks, and then I was given a Hef instead of the pineapple cider I ordered. No problem. Mistakes happen, and they let my friend keep the beer free of charge. But by the time our waitress came back to find out/and when she came back with the correct drink, my friends were already finished with their's and ready for the check. Which we asked twice for and also had to track down our waitress to ask the final time.   It may have been an off day for our waitress. So I would give it another shot if my friends suggest it.  The beers are more expensive here than usual, but it's Vegas...usually everything is more expensive on the Strip. That's expected.

5eQ5PLjszXqk_wVYyONQuA.text: If you're looking for a place to grab a great beer in a laid back environment, this is definitely the place for you. The relaxed atmosphere is a good break from all the chaos of Vegas and they have all the beer you could ever dream of! I recommend getting the sampler, four 6oz glasses of draft beer of your choosing.  Along with the abundant selection of beer, the view was excellent. You can enjoy a front seat to the Bellagio water show and the strip. This view makes Beer Park unique by creating more of an experience than just an average trip to the bar. Definitely check this place out!

MCEWz2vpDBjZmSDGHJaWLQ.text: This place appeals to a very specific type of customer.  It is an outdoor sports bar.  Very loud.  Very crowded.  Seating at picnic tables with hard wooden benches.  Decent bar food.  Pretty good cocktails.  Nice view of the Strip from parts of the restaurant.  It's as close as you can get to a frat party without entering a frat house.  A good place to go if you like that kind of thing.  Personally, I lost my taste for that kind of thing somewhere around my junior year in college.  I will say that we had a beautiful April evening to enjoy.  How things would be in the 110 degree heat of Vegas summer days, or the 40 degree cold of Vegas winter nights, I can't imagine.  And I don't intend to find out.

Z5SiLQ2Cg3-_P8eclMXKuA.text: Fun games!!!! Cool spot, good beer. Came here with my boyfriend and we played a massive connect the dot! So fun!

She would not give us separate checks, refused to honor my groupon discount (another issue I will take up with groupon a d paypal).   Needless to say NO TIP.

bquDeBVDSY9jiI7bnDQZcA.text: Our last day in Vegas---late flight, no room (check-out was 11), etc.---and we were tired from being on our feet for several hours. We stepped outside Paris Casino, and there was Beer Park (actually we had to go up some stairs to get to it, but no big deal). It was a chilly day and this is an open-air bar and grill, so the heaters at the bar were so welcome! We ordered a Busch beer for each of us, and proceeded to chill. There are charging stations at the bar (some don't work), and these were so appreciated. There is a great view of the Strip and especially Bellagio across the street.  We spent quite a bit of time at the bar, and Alex was great with our orders, questions, and conversations!

k9QHLJN_ZbO-XlLeCxofhQ.text: Great location to enjoy a nice cold beer while watching the Bellagio Fountains.. Delicious garlic fries

mxOPCHZIQK-UXmMYyLfs9g.text: The beer park is the hidden hot spot located in front of the Paris hotel! This Budweiser establishment brings me back to the college days and is definitely filled with a younger and hip crowd!  They have tons of great bites to eat that go great with your adult beverage and so much entertainment. From tv screens all over the place showcasing every type of sport that is on to huge jenga and pool tables.   The decor is super clean and modern! They have tables for groups, picnic tables, lounge areas or you can sit at the bar. The service was great and the music was a throwback ode to my college years of the early to mid 2000s.

4CpcnzXIzaqxlhDC325X2g.text: Great atmosphere and view. Food was much better than we expected for bar type restaurant. Highly recommend for an afternoon lunch.

Location is great, you can see the Bellagio fountains and just people watch from the rooftop.  We didn't order beer, but ordered a few of the cocktails. They were good, but just a little too sweet for us. We also ordered the fish and chips, but subbed out for coleslaw. It was so delicious- highly recommend ordering that!  Only reason it's not a full 5 stars is because they could've definitely had more servers, but it might have just been an off night where they were short staffed.  Will for sure be back!

JQhUIqqJ8RJfvgo8_jEZIA.text: This place looked great on Yelp. Service was fine and didn't drink but the ambiance didn't match what we expected. Beer choices were reasonable. Where you end up sitting definitely matters - especially when the LV sun is beating down.

It's usually pretty busy, so make a reservation beforehand to get a table spot.  The loaded tater tots are addicting! What blend they use for the cheese sauce is so good.    They also have a great beer flight deal: any draft beer choices - 4 6oz glasses for $15. Great selection!

It's always busy and full of people, and a great view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. They have a great selection of beers for a reasonable price for being on the strip.

p61z3niB0vb-Lej5zN2r8w.text: Fast seating, good beer flight, good food, even during the world series game when we were there.  Waitresses were fast and attentive, in the midst of chaos.  That said, it was $$$.

pqUUc9XY9A03yoMsaVnngA.text: Spent about three hours hanging out here on a Sunday afternoon. Great beer prices and selection. Tried a few apps. The braided pretzal is to die for. Best nachos I have had anywhere. The chicken drumbsticks are a nice twist on traditional wings. Just as tasty but a lot more meat.  Really enjoyed tge music and the vibe of the bar.

0Xw5AvyZ8pAP9UFjxeZOEw.text: Great place to hang with friends and drink good beer. Great view of the strip. Great times with fun games.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer for days!

L64WvZBUJYNYt7g15luV6g.text: Brought the family here for dinner. Had the kahuna cowboy burger. It was pretty tasty. The wife had a salad. She wasn't too impressed with it. They don't have a printed kids menu but they do have options. Ordered the mini corn dogs. The portions are pretty huge for kids and they were very good. Great place to bring the family and has a baby changing station in the bathroom. Service was excellent. The only reason why they didn't get 5 stars is because their beer selection is pretty weak. There are also some table and board games so it would be a fun place to hang out with friends.

6lO_dcVoJ7lRP9_0GfTLCg.text: I've gone here once and my husband has been here three times.  It wasn't until the last time that we noticed the CNF.  What is a CNF?  It's a "Concession and Franchise Fee" that charges you an additional 4.7% FOR NO REASON.  You get nothing for this fee.  Throughout Vegas, the majority of restaurants do not charge for this BS fee, but Beer Park is one that DOES.  It sucks, because when I was there they actually had a bottle of my favorite beer there which is pretty hard to find.  Will I come back?  No.  My favorite beer is usually $11 a bottle.  Beer Park charged $27 for the same bottle... and then slapped us with a 4.7% fee for NO reason.  Make sure you look at the very fine print to see if your Vegas restaurant charges this fee.  You can find it in tiny writing on the menu.  Then, do yourself a favor and don't attend these restaurants.    We all know how expensive many Vegas restaurants are anyway.  Is this secretly devious fee necessary?  No.  Just like resort fees and having to pay for parking, it's one more way Las Vegas is trying their best to steal every penny from customers and keep other tourists away.  In addition to boycotting, fill out a trip advisor or yelp review about this place.  Post the information on Facebook and Twitter and tag them.  Let the company know what their doing is unethical and thieves like this should not be supported.  It's not the bartenders' fault so please don't take it out on them.  It's the owners and they should be reminded multiple times a day how much money they're losing every day when customers avoid their establishment and go elsewhere for a beer.  What's the best way to let them know?  Take one second to write up something like this online.  It's a shame.  Most customers don't even realize this occurred until the check is given.  PLEASE CHECK YOUR BILLS CAREFULLY.   Ask for a manager.  Let them know you won't be returning due to this fake fee.  Cheers.

1tP_-0_jaJykwsWRWviVCw.text: Guacamole burger was good.  Lots of tvs to watch the game. Beer is expensive, but I guess the strip view and experience is what you're buying.

YrFdfz82JdUQG9_fC_d3CQ.text: If you love beer then you'll love this place! Beer Park has a great selection of IPA's! Food portions are huge so share or bring your appetite:) Definitely a great place for big groups and for anyone that wants to just have a chat or enjoy the lovely view. The fact that its right across from the Bellagio fountain, it doesn't get any better than that. Its super low key and I really love that its outdoorsy!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sierra Nevada and Elysian Space Dust

Cnm3Db900HaI8LPn9Ay1Ug.text: Such a fun atmosphere and food was on point. We loved the view of the fountains at the Bellagio! Prices were reasonable for the location and portion sizes. Staff were upbeat and friendly. Would definitely return!

F-LOKImY2CvrxkBD_ng2GQ.text: I can't offer a review for the food but as for everything else I can offer nothing but great reviews.  I had seen this on Thrillist and I knew right away that I just had to come here.  We got here a little after they opened so it wasn't very busy. We were able to score great seats, facing the Bellagio fountains, we also moved to more comfy lounge type sofas after a while. Only downside is that you couldn't get servers to come to that area, no worries, walking up to the bar wasn't bad.  I tried a few beers until I found the one that I loved. They have a decent selection of beers and of beer concoctions. They serve you ice cold water in red solo looking cups and the place is huge.  They have 2 pool tables, it's free, all you do is leave them your ID. They have a connect 4 game, and a few Jenga games.  I enjoyed my time at this place and would have been happy staying all day but we had to leave because of dinner reservations that we could not cancel at the Eiffel Tower.  This is a fun, laid back place to get away from Vegas and its craziness.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salud!
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved this view
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of bar area

P-dfPioPq1yNsxs42SyWoQ.text: I was having a rather unsavory day. It could have been, how shall we say... much better. I've never met a beer I didn't like... that's not True at all... but on this day, I decided it was time to drink. Cut the bullshit and just get down to it. So I wandered my way down the strip and stumbled upon a small park, built for adults. A beer park.  My server was named Mya and she did wonderful things. She brought me beers. More than one. She helped me solve my math homework once I was too drunk, and you could tell that she really cared. Like really took an interest in me. Not just the beer I was drinking, but the content of my character as well. And I'm a wonderful person, without question. Please don't question it.  There was something called a Fiesta Salad, and that motherfucker was delicious. It tasted like a party in my mouth... A party I will not forget.   I'll always look back on that day. It was one hell of a park to stumble into while drunk and it did not disappoint.

chhIMv5xzL7zId-4v3nr8g.text: I'm glad I opened my YELP app in vegas when looking for a place to hang out!!! This place is perfect,overlooking the strip and a prime view of the water fountain show at the Belagio!! Plenty of beers on tap,Lots of games to pass the time,and more than enuff TVs for all your sports needs!!the food is also good here,and the staff is super friendly and helpful..WIll be back every time I go to VEgas!!! BTW,Bartender Laura is the Best!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just found my fave sports bar on the vagas strip!! This place is RIDICULOUSLY good!!!!!

PJXGDCq6x0OxcAK-kw-skw.text: Good draft beer selection as well as draft cocktails, food very good for the price. Groupon has $40 off as well. Space is outdoors so be prepared for the weather. They do have misters and lots of fans though.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smothered waffle fries

3WJnNWhw_JB8RFR3aDIF5Q.text: Really nine place to chill and have a few drinks.  The beer menu was great and the bartenders are really nice and very attractive.  There are many fun activities to partake in like beer pong, corn hole, and over sized Jenga.  I got a guacamole Burger and it exceeded my expectations.  Great view of the strip and a great place to hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer pong action..
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Massive beer selection..

U-vAnT-FxzHLhxh5m0W6yw.text: Kahuna Cowboy burger was "just good bar food". Cool atmosphere and the typical Vegas scene. I'd have given 4 stars if a place with "beer" in its name had more ... uh ... beers to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kahuna Cowboy w pickles

0RtTEiuaaLlVLEIpoU0E3w.text: This place has the worst service ever. We waited at our table for nearly 30 minutes and did not get acknowledge once not even for water. No hello, nothing , felt invisible. I wish the service was good because the environment is really cool, but the service Ruined the experience for me. I don't recommend this place, especially on a busy day.

ySDcUEhumYJmZYxqcU1hEQ.text: Good atmosphere, fun music, game was on. Service was great and was checked on frequently. And fast seeing how busy it was

DtUvfEFgldcgNWOlqc2o8g.text: Shuffleboard. Connect 4. Lifesize jenga. Need I say more? Oh. Kid friendly!! The deep fried macncheese is delish!! A must visit with great views and activities. Oh. And beer too!

mMhNmdUefXEBy7lk3Q8D3w.text: What a nice surprise! We stumbled across the Beer Park while walking down the strip and are glad we did! The view was great, the prices were remarkably affordable and the food was tasty and satisfying. Casual, recognizable food with a twist. Garlic-Parm fries were simple  but tasty (Baconaise..!!!) the Chicken BLT was fresh with lots of bacon and the Pastrami Ruben was tender and fresh. Service was great from the time we were greeted till we walked out and the hostess asked how things were and thanked us for coming. I would definitely recommend!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oPMQtwXuNQmWmAFrHFZFQA.text: Ok, so I still really like this place. BUT - a couple of things have changed.  1) They have this BS fee called "CNF" they add to your tab which is essentially a franchise fee they are charging us. I am a bit over Vegas and their fees - and this is another one of them that is something the business itself is charging - not a tax. AND you don't know it until after you get the bill. There are several restaurants/bars on the strip doing this.  My question is - why is this a charge? Why isn't this wrapped into the actual food/beverage costs? Instead - it just creates this angst by being a line item on the bill.  2) Chicken drumsticks have changed. You now get 4 tiny ones - and they are not bbq anymore, they are buffalo. Not a fan.  Other than that - music is awesome, location is awesome, the venue is awesome, staff is great. Great experience.

RgzFFKuO8-2C7QJ6LULMhA.text: This place has a great location but unfortunately the food is way over priced and they charge and undisclosed resort fee of 5% aka CNF fee on your check. I'm a Vegas local that eats out daily and Ordred the carne asada for $23. I received 4 small pieces of meat and two tortillas some guacamole. Javiers across the street at aria has much better food and bigger portions for the same price. The extra fee they charge is ridiculous. No other restaurants on the strip add it and the bartender had no explanation as to why it's there or what other value the customer receives because of it. If we hadn't asked she would not have disclosed it.

fYncVB1sSqEfQ5X-eweU7w.text: We were HUNGRY and looking for an easy place to meet a group of friends for lunch. The food was okay but beware - this is a sports bar and it was LOUD.   We were lured in by the rooftop seating on a pretty day. Unfortunately, we couldn't find a less than mind-numbingly loud spot blaring the Saturday football game.   The food was okay. My caesar was surprisingly good for a bar. The boyfriend had the spicy bratwurst and liked it. The ribs were okay but my friend disliked her chicken BLTA. Hands down, the best food on the table was the small crock of mac n cheese. This place also had a good selection of beers but at $9 per pint.   We came, we ate meh food and we lost our voices trying to converse over the game. It's a decent place - just set expectations for the loud atmosphere!

iEzsGsy9PCiIxOR61_rEnQ.text: Don't know much about the bar, but the bottom margarita garden will over charge you for their frozen drinks!!!!!  Watch out for their price scams!!!  You'll see when you get there. I paid $30 for a 32oz???? It's Vegas, I know...... BUT you'll see how they lure you in and get you after they serve you.  No wonder I didn't see many people buying any.  Now I know why!  Nobody has posted this info.

YWIjEq8MNqhyJ4_U9kH1sg.text: This location was a really cute stop on the way back to our hotel. It's located on the second level right before the entrance to the Paris casino. We went during December so it was windy and cold but the heaters kept it a perfect temperate (it's a patio style place). We got two beers and the Mac and cheese egg rolls and they all cost about $10-11 each, which isn't bad compared to some Vegas strip restaurants. The servers were nice and fast and they also had table games to play. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RVBwROdDO7wetC2KAwJxaA.text: A good beer and eats place centrally located on the edge of Paris Casino and Resort property on The Strip. Famous for a voluminous variety of beers. Indeed, a very nice selection. Big draw here: #femaledj Lydia Ansel and her violin playing to her disc jockey Club music. Beyond amazing.   The food is gourmet comfort food, Mary-Courtney and Alex were my servers. If you aren't spending $30 per person, you aren't doing it right. This is a place that deserves an exemplary tip because of the attentive servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The incredible Lydia Ansel on the turntable... Worth some heart and soul!

TCY8uKZqMy3mk6Tszyhopw.text: NICE ROOFTOP BAR W/ BELLAGIO VIEW  I've been to Vegas for years and never knew this was up here! Great outdoor restaurant/bar with a nice variety of music blasting from the DJ. Best part of this joint is the VIEW! We sat on the ledge looking right across to Bellagio Fountains!  Fish and chip: 5/5 the fish was fresh and flaky and batter was crispy not oily at all. The crinkle cut fries were crispy too and enough to share.   Philly Cheese Sandwich: 4/5 husband enjoyed this. He doesn't usually like pickles but theirs was delicious and perfect with the sandwich. Doesn't come with sides which deducted a star. (We ordered onion rings which looked yummy but the server forgot about them- didn't even say sorry).   Micheladas here are BOMB.  Definitely coming back.

AYy2FeuyhEjOdE0tFCvcWg.text: They gave me birthday shots and the games made the wait for the food fly by. Right across from the water show the rooftop gives you a view of the what you see on movies "Vegas"

KJ4M9fGs3SOQ7yG3Su7YNQ.text: Good food, good beer, good price and lots of sports idk what else you could ask for.  Definitely know that this is a more tourist spot for when you wanna pound some beers early in the day and watch some games this isn't like a family lunch or dinner spot. Very load and lots of drunk people hootin and hollerin but if you are on vacation here and are trying to get hammered with some good bar food for a fair price in the strip this your spot. Some come hoot and holler and drink some beet and cheer for your favorite sports team.

Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-3bbdESqghdXCNonbyAClw.text: Kyllene took care of our group today and exalted exceptional customer service and professionalism. Her attentiveness and hospitality brought our experience to a different level, we'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UWrpRErKw6jsKu4QtRw-BA.text: Talk about straight party atmosphere from the minute start walking up the stairs. Honestly for second I was thinking am I going to club or restaurant? Beer Park not listed under clubs! Lol! If looking for party atmosphere smack on the Vegas strip Beer Park is cool spot! Most of the restaurant is open so great outdoor dining when weather perfect. Plus get perfect view of the Bellagio fountain show across the street. Panoramic view! They have bunch of games for everyone to play from oversized Jenga blocks, air hockey, board games, and more. There one spot most of the games are at kind of lounge/games area. Great chill spot for group. Lots of televisions all of them on sports.  It was our first stop for cousins foodie tour. We ended up getting couple appetizers and drinks kick start the night! The appetizers we got the Chile Verde Nachos and Loaded Tater Tots. Both were good but no "wow" factor. The Chile Verde Nachos would recommend over the Loaded Tater Tots. It nice portion of nachos. Just the right amount of toppings that it not smothered. So even once get to the bottom chips still crispy and toppings left. The beer list is pretty solid. Diverse, lot of choices, and something for every beer fan. The service was five stars. Our waitress was friendly, attentive, and awesome.  The only negative is the place is so loud. It not often see my cousins. Its hard to have conversations with group.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Verde Nachos

k_Lcs5nrPkWP5RiEzD8IOQ.text: Great atmosphere. The service was a bit slow. Our waitress disappeared for a while. Pleasant young lady but definately needs work with her multi tasking. Food was ok. I had the ahi tuna sandwich, a lot of fat in it. It was tough to eat. Beer was good. Nice selection of beer. In all a not a bad place, I'll give it another chance.

xvDo1zBnjcGirWJdtn15FA.text: Guy with the three-stripe tattoo: best bartender in town!!! He made me my own beer cocktail and it was awesome, thanks!

qsujCXlchdU9psi5_kAh_A.text: Sometimes, Vegas can be very overwhelming because there are so many options - We were looking for a fun spot to hang out midday and Beer Park was very close to our hotel.  It was exactly the vibe we were looking for. It was fun, casual with a dose of whimsy. We had a late lunch and ordered wings and the carne asada. I thought the carne asada was very dry and do not recommend it.   The patio bar was located on the second floor. It could be very sunny but there are a lot of umbrellas and shade to keep you covered. I loved the view of Bellagio water show - I wouldn't mind coming back

y9L_6ypzKtS3c_v5sRoliQ.text: The sign outside said "our beers are colder than your ex's heart" it should actually read "...than our servers' hearts"   Other than the view there is nothing that would get me to go back to this place. The service was slow and very unfriendly. There was an hour long wait at the restaurant we wanted to eat at so we came here for a few drinks. It should not take one entire hour to get one round of drinks while you're seated: we sat down, waited, waited some more, finally got up to get menus, waited, asked a server to grab our server, server comes looking unhappy, we order, wait some more, we get a call from the restaurant that our table is ready and are forced to chug our drinks because in one hour we had JUST managed to get our drinks. However slow they are to get you your drinks they are exponentially faster at taking your money since paying took about four seconds.  I will however mention that the drinks were delicious and all of us were happy with our choices off the cocktail menu, but I would've loved more time to enjoy them since there was about a three minute gap between getting our drinks and having to leave.   Overall: the view is great but there are a million other places on the strip with a nice view with far better service. You can easily skip this place.

92uNqviGPRtabt47rX3g3w.text: I enjoyed our visit to Beer Park.  We were two couples and we had drinks and dinner.   Our server was really nice and at first was quite attentive, but later she seemed to have forgotten about us.  Its outdoors, but they have heaters so even though it was cold, it was comfortable.  They have many games lying around and there was a giant Jenga that we were playing with.  My friends split the Cowboy burger and loaded waffle fries, my husband ordered the Beer Park Pie and I just had loaded tots.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  The mixed drinks were tasty.   Just be prepared there are no healthy dishes here... all grease and bar food!  But, that can be good every once in a while.    I'd probably go back.  I think it would be a fun place for a big group.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zrxnst877kfYsNgIHllgvQ.text: This restaurant has a beautiful view of the Las Vegas strip and is located right across from the Bellagio. This was a very fun,  relaxed and interactive atmosphere. There were different games available such as Uno, shuffleboard, connect four and cornhole. There's a huge selection of craft beers along with a nice menu selection. The food was delicious, but I'm rating four stars because the staff seemed very disorganized and it took us a while to finally get service. Overall, we enjoyed our visit and had a good time. I would highly recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qEoRozg8_1lt9gFH1EZ6Qg.text: I was so excited to try out this new place at the Paris only to be let down.   It's usually pretty crowded and loud which isn't super surprising. It's really the food and service that give this place the bad rating.   We went here twice and weren't impressed by the food either time. It was mediocre at best. We got loaded fries, burgers, and brats that were all not very good.   The service was even worse. It took forever for them to take our order, forever to get our food, and we never got water refills. They forgot parts of our order.   All in all, it's a great concept with a terrible execution. I won't be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iLBBD1V0t8sNhZJt0TPBRA.text: This is probably my new favorite sports bar in Vegas!! I can't believe I never realized it was here, right across from the Bellagio where I normally stay. Being the football fan that I am and finally gaining the courage to make a few sports bets, my stepdad and I decided to go off MGM property to watch the game (since the sports bar and sports book in the casinos don't serve food...I mean, how can you watch sports without food??)  Amazingly, it wasn't crowded at all, especially considering the number of games on.   It's upstairs, near Paris. It's like an outdoor mancave!! Sparkly green turf covered the floor, TVs every direction you look, built in heaters, picnic-style tables with board games galore and a hidden receptacle for bottled beverages! The whole thing is outdoors so dress accordingly, but do remember they have heaters :-)  Ladies, there are even purse rings to hang your purse at the end of each table! They have a life-size Jenga, Connect Four, and other fun games that adults would love to partake in!!  We were only craving appetizers since were going to eat dinner after the game. My stepdad got the 7-Layer Dip and I got the Guacamole. Our server said all the appetizers were shareable...see pictures. That guac was not only NOT shareable, but hard to eat out of that tiny container. But it WAS good. I can't wait to go back and try their real food!! Those waffle fries are calling my name...  They serve you with what LOOKS like plastic red SOLO cups and paper plates but...SURPRISE!!! They're actually ceramic or something!! Way cool.  My only real complaint is that our server refilled my stepdad' s beer 3 times but never refilled my soda. I actually had to call her over and ask, even though every time she visited our table my cup was most obviously empty. I get it, free refills don't earn the money.  You can take awesome pics of the strip in either direction.  It's just a really neat place, my new favorite in Vegas :-)  Oh!! They don't have blended drinks but right below them is a little store with just blended beverages. FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sparkly turf!
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Um...hard to dip my chip

3uExVqGO75qIx0kJxdvHYA.text: Beer Park has a great location, great views, great service, great portions and a fun environment.   My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place out and finally did when he saw it on Groupon. Menu is kind of pricey so I definitely recommend getting the Groupon to get your money's worth.   My boyfriend ordered the Kahuna Cowboy Burger ($11.95) while I got the Smoked Prime Rib Cheesesteak ($12.95). Additionally, we both shared a side of Mac and Cheese ($6.95) and Loaded Tater Tots ($9.95). I'd say the best part of the meal were the sides. The Mac and Cheese was so creamy and with a little bit more cheese, it would've been even more delicious. The Bass IPA cheese sauce and the bacon did wonders for the fries. I liked that the fries weren't completely drenched in cheese and sour cream, keeping it from being soggy.  My boyfriend loved the flavoring of the bbq sauce in his Kahuna Cowboy Burger. However, he found his burger too wet, making the pretzel bun soggy. The Smoked Prime Rib Cheesesteak was good, but not amazing. The prime rib was on the dry side and lacking flavor. I had to put some pineapples and jalapenos that came with my boyfriend's burger as well as hot sauce.   I wish I remembered our server's name because she was extremely nice and attentive. When seating us she even made sure that we weren't sitting directly in the sun considering how hot it was that day. Lastly, Beer Park has games you can play, which is great when waiting for your food or even while enjoying your food. This is a great spot to hangout with friends and/or colleagues. I would even recommend it for a casual date.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded tater tots
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kahuna Cowboy Burger - bun was soggy
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Prime Rib Cheesesteak - prime rib was dry

zYoUbMJv7GwgnxSvWdhPlg.text: I am going to start off by saying if you expect cheap beer at this place, you won't find it. They offer many craft beers, a fantastic patio setting with games and super friendly staff.  After looking over the beer menu, I couldn't settle on just one. Then I found the deal worth getting there. They offer 4 six ounce beers for $14. Any of their craft beers on tap. ANY OF THEM. That is such a great deal, especially if you are going with higher alcohol heavy beers. That is just what I did. My husband and I each picked 4 beers and it was the perfect choice. We were a bit hungry, so we got the mac and cheese eggrolls. To some this may sound weird, but to a foodie like me, this was amazing. House smoked bacon and a three cheese blend wrapped in amazingness. They serve it with several sauces for your liking. It was the perfect bite to go with the awesome beer choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese eggrolls
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best deal! Any 4 six ounce beers for $14

VPhNgWY6fMQLkpyDyX_Wwg.text: My friends and I came to Beer Park for NFL Sunday Football expecting good food and non-stop football. We only got the non-stop football part. The food was honestly mediocre at best.   We started with the Popcorn chicken which is covered in buffalo sauce and cheese, pretty average.   For our mains, some of us ordered the Kahuna Burger which looked great on paper, but just was not what we were expecting. The Burger also comes with no sides so I ordered a basket of Sweet potato fries which were not good at all. Others ordered the Turkey wrap which was also pretty bad. The service was just as bad as the food, maybe because it was crowded for NFL Sunday but still no excuse.  The only Pro's about this place are the TV screens everywhere to watch Football and the great selection of beers.

hwN9hjbJFx3KzkodW71Vdw.text: Atmosphere was great overlooking the strip. Elevated so nice breeze. Lots of tvs and fun games. Had pool, beer pong, shuffleboard, jenga, and more. Had their burgers which were tasty, good selection of beers and they have cocktails too! Very nice chill spot . Would def. hit up this spot again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

358ot7GjM83ur4aBEAdQzA.text: Fun place to eat and have a few beers.  They have a wide variety of beers on tap.  We had appetizers , the popcorn chicken, Mac and cheese egg rolls and load tots, they were all good.  The best part was bringing our 20 year old daughter and her boyfriend and playing a board game at our table while my husband and I were able to have adult drinks.  The Beer Park has a fun youthful feel to it.  The service and staff was great.

EHjVekjI7BD8X3v7TOf3bA.text: They have a problem with bees here. Beware if you are allergic. I just moved my seat from the balcony to the bar area after a bee took a dip in my drink. The bartender said we have them here too. Ok. So nowhere here is safe. Thanks for the warning.   Someone contacted me to say I was a moron for writing this (perhaps someone who works there) Let me clarify. I ate at Sammy Hagars one block away and outside without any bees.  Yes there is a problem when I personally witness another couple ask for their check to leave because of the bees buzzing around and the waiter can't even clear the table. Yes there is a problem when I have to move my seat and when the waitstaff admits it when I tell them. Yes it's a problem when there is bee in your $11 drink you want to finish and have to fish it out.   I wish I took a video of the people using their menus to swat bees or a photo of the one swimming in my drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A note I got from someone apparently unhappy that I informed people about the bees.

CSyqgp8EoxoUhP4xrsWklQ.text: Great ambiance outdoor venue with great TV & music with water misting to keep you cool.  The food was average for the price but were able to get all 14 of us at one table.  When it come time for the bill, they restricted our payment to three credit cards.  Unfortunately, this wasn't shared up front. Therefore, the reason for 4 not 5 stars.  I would go back in the future with a smaller group

kN_HQDdy5b8b_GY7MQMmYQ.text: Wasn't expecting to find this gem overlooking The Strip! Lots of cold stuff on tap and our bartender Allen made the best mojitos in Vegas! It's easy to get to from outside, but it's a bit of a journey if you self park at Paris. Worth the trip!

JLgwBxrZEr74F3-NWmLS1Q.text: A fun place to sit and people/car watch while having drinks.   The Beer Park has a nice selection of craft beers including two of my favorites from Goose Island: Green Line and Sofie.   We were sat immediately by a cheerful hostess and then served excellently by "Karen". Karen stayed on top of our needs the whole time and tried to keep us longer but alas, we wanted to walk the Strip.   While sitting on the balcony deck we had a great view of the people and cars going up and down the main strip. We also watch the water show across the street at the Bellagio.   There is a stage on the balcony and I was told by Karen that Beer Park was having a lip syncing contest that night at midnight. We got to watch several rehearsals and knew that the event was going to be cool.   We ordered a few small plates to compliment the beer. They were good but not to die for. On the other hand we didn't go into the Beer Park to eat so we were not disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goose Island &#34;Sofie&#34;
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the Bellagio from the deck.

IzfnFyvQg5InrGZ2UT6V1Q.text: Hot spot on our last night in Vegas and it did not disappoint. Great flavors and nice portions. Guacamole burger and pulled pork appetizer was some of the best food on this trip. Plus awesome DJ hits! Loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork -so good...

BhFbckFpQjbCj-YkriIPZQ.text: Favorite outdoor patio to watch football on vegas! The waffle fries w ale cheese and pulled pork was phenomenal. They also have a ton of sauces like the burger and chicken sauce which was fun. Drinks were decent and come in a heavy plastic cup. They do Togo your drinks here too if you can't finish so need to chug!

HZHfaqpkkslSUcp72izKOw.text: Enjoyed this place alot! We got a large bottle of Lolita and sat at the edge of the balcony for an amazing view of the strip. We usually stay at Paris or Ceasars so this is really convenient and cant really beat the strip view. The bartender was friendly.   Unfortunately this place closes depending on how busy they are, we came on a Sunday so they closed down early.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm lolita!

1w61aC4p3LlfbDotrTSvTw.text: This place is great. It is right across from Bellagio. You get an AMAZING view. Their service is great as well and they play the best music!

ods7Yum1SZXQHXIZxO79sg.text: Pros: - great views of strip - variety of taps  Cons: - expensive as heck (2 drinks = $35+/before tip) - terrible service - overcrowded - cumbersome to get to  You're paying for the view and the atmosphere, better finds on other parts of the strip.

Dkx8Ali0_Xc-4lngesfyAA.text: I am a local here in Las Vegas and frequently brought my friends and family to this place because the location is awesome, the view of the strip is great and the games are fun. Concept is like a backyard bbq on the Fourth of July. But the staff is horrific, the management is embarrassing and they badly need to take a hint from every other Vegas bar on the strip that treats their customers with respect. Won't be back.

0k6oQ-hYQyf3z6Mkau78hA.text: Could the name and marketing be ploys? The selection was smaller than my dreams and the ads set me up for.   It's a tad steep here. Totally a tourist trap as others suggested. Viva Las Vegas! That being said, the atmosphere is nice and enjoyable, with lots of tvs.   Oh, the beer isn't bad. I found a few I thoroughly enjoyed and could probably find more, but again, maybe not at these prices. I felt bad for all the guys getting Budlights. Lol.   Beers on tap, chile verde nachos and brats are why I'd return.

3svCIHr-8GBvgLH3-j8lMA.text: The view was great!! Open and the waiters were super nice, except for the blond bartender she was a dumb acting breezy, asked her about the drinks and she answered us by saying; you have the the menu!!! I would recommend to stay at your table and wait for the server that actually have customer service, even the busboy knows how to act!!!
