J7bRyRpfurmh0pPAI7XtDA.text: Another new sports bar, we were there for their soft opening. Excellent service, food was good, great view of the Surrounding area, including the Bellagio water show. Lots of choices of beer, wine on tap (good wine, not cheap crap). All open air. Not cheap, but what is in Vegas?

pBCNjcS1pSeKz588ujaK2Q.text: 1st of all, Darlene (D) was amazing. Greeted us immediately, service was on point, and thoroughly attended to us though our lunch. The atmosphere is amazing at Beer Park. Great patio, great view of the strip, and open area with lots of TVs. The food was amazing! BBQ burger was amazing and we shared the loaded tots! Which we almost licked the plates. Highly recommend Beer Pam :)

XhLEeROTnSMeravPUgPyXg.text: The location and food was amazing!  Darlene was such an awesome server!  I will most def be coming back!  This place has a great vibe!

2oS98p_LOxewm1adnbxiAQ.text: Great atmosphere and a fun place day or night!  Good food and a great place to drink and watch the Bellagio Fountains or watch a game on the many TV's.     I think this is a must visit as it feels like you are tailgating on the Strip with friendly people!  Best of all it is above all the hustlers that harass you on the sidewalk.

fk3aId-NWF972306HxC2OA.text: Gave this spot a 4 thanks to the view otherwise a 3.... but for the STRIP PRICES are fair.. Great Munchie Food. Brats , Beer , Brisket!

g3FcO4NGEIAOJ5KF2k5ufg.text: We had a good time here. Food was good. Good burgers,onion rings,signature hot dog and all kind of beers. Normal prices for food very expensive beer. Good atmosphere. Nice place.

C3vzT-UqLYWOmwa1_t1xtg.text: Beer park is so amazing! Can't wait to hang out there for Super Bowl! Best views on the strip in the heart of Las Vegas blvd with great food and awesome staff. So excited to bring my friends.

cagja5JmXnhYtcsBkqYpJw.text: I have a group of 10 people in Las Vegas from New England. All huge Patriots fans. We made a reservation at Beer Park and we're guaranteed to be able to watch the patriots game on a large screen. It seems, that they have a rule that The team who's fans have the most reservations get to hear the sound on their particular game. It seemed to me and my group that there were substantially less fans for the sound of the game we heard. There were far more Patriots fans in the bar but they refused to turn on sound for us.  We were the loudest cheering fans there and heard hardly anything for the game they were playing the sound for which is very upsetting. The food was good the service was just OK. While I would recommend Beer Park for the food and if you want to see your game on the big screen you may not necessarily hear it.....

96V6KEnElHAPODBKEZjSeg.text: The beer park had a great atmosphere and great food! We visited this spot on a Friday afternoon to kick off our Vegas trip. The beer options are endless and it is a great venue to watch sporting events (NCAA basketball tournament was on). I would recommend the loaded tater tots. I tried the mac and cheese egg rolls and would say they are unique but kind of a weird pairing and aren't very filling. Otherwise they do have a variety of food options so you don't have to settle on your typical ball park hot dog. The design and atmosphere are well thought out, the only complaint is that majority of the seats are in the direct sun, and we visited in March and was hot after an hour, I can only imagine this spot in the summer ( maybe build some shade structures/fans). Overall I would definitely visit again.

luTc8yXvKTgaQENtkLyKww.text: One word... AMAZING! Their staff, especially Ebony is very very outgoing and kind. This place gives that chill/party vibe. Food & Drinks are really great!

xytTDmhkNctPhrYHnruivA.text: Best rooftop bar in Las Vegas! As a local, I dont go down to the strip very often, if at all. But, that has changed with Beer Park opening up. Staff is great, great atmosphere overlooking las vegas blvd and beer is cold!

jF4feWOzJYHHwPk5dXfG5g.text: Great spot! I didn't order food but did catch a Cubs play-off game on the big TVs as I enjoyed some great beer.  It is pricey so you need to expect you are paying a premium for the view and the beer selection.  As long as you know what you are paying for you won't be disappointed.

fcFR3wfE8WOPEet4bmJHLQ.text: Great place to people watch!  Very good drinks, lots of choices and reasonable prices.  Staff was fun and energetic.

KUTasDHoK3sFHJQDG_Y_8A.text: The location is perfect - right across from Belagio, outside seating and good music. The food is just okay I had the grilled chicken blt sandwich and the others had burgers. The bread was entirely too thick, it wasn't toasted or soft, it was a bit much. The fries tasted like frozen ore ida fries- and they charge $4.95 for a side of fries - they're not included wit the burger. I don't mind spending money her in Vegas but the Shake Shack is waaayyy better!

JSFMJh_7iuqnj9VdSB39TQ.text: I am giving three stars for this restaurant for the simple fact that they were still so new. I would give it a second chance, but the first experience was less than stellar. Went with a group for moms bday and had a great table with an amazing view. The service and food were definitely still in the trial and error phase, food all came out separately and some items were wrong. Buckets of beer were expensive, but hey it's Vegas so there is nothing you can do about that. Our waitress was a bit stressed and when I asked her how she was doing, she said she was struggling and was getting no help from management. Overall there are just minor fixes that would make this place great! Will have to give another chance when I return to Vegas.

s7eMJa2bwIR6HXoViUaL4g.text: Great place 1st time there! Views are awesome beer selection is spot on. Can't wait to go back!

2gsB_Ko08jxDG4rb2_pytg.text: This place has great views of the strip. Went on a Friday night and the music was great a lot of early 2000 hip hop and r&b. The place was very clean and the setup was well thought out. The tables are park benches and each sit about 12 guests (Im assuming.) there is also bar seating and stools around the perimeter of the place where you can get the best view. There are also couches to lounge around on. the beer selection is great, didn't ask if they had double IPAs but I'm sure they do. Our waitress was great, I don't remember her name but she's Asian and very friendly. Service was quick and the food was good too.

Yhc9GLMRXScazwS2McvjwQ.text: Beware of this restaurant. Bait and switched us with Groupon deal. Would not accept anytime there is a sporting event on televisions there. There is ALWAYS a sporting event on there. Manager told us the wording on the Groupon is vague on purpose so that they can do this to people.

0pkzb0JgxeI-dXRfvWZT9w.text: My new favorite spot!!! The food is beyond great, it offers a great view of the strip and the staff is AMAZING!! Definitely a must visit when in Vegas!!!

O3nfy6-u4q9up1vh9wWgWw.text: Rachel always gives exceptional service.. Her peers can learn a thing from her of what it means to give great service. When her what looked be like her boss and fellow hosts wouldn't accommodate a local party of three Rachel said " let me see if anyone is about to leave" instead of No we can't help you make a reservation. Rachel always gives a 100% and she's truly a  asset to this company. Food is generous proportions, plenty of screens to watch a game and lively crowd. This is a fun place to eat, enjoy a beer and watch a game :)

SnNGu1WwH3qfS6p0JpU78g.text: Beer park is a wonderful Plave for happy hours and dinner.   We took over part of their restaurant with an impromptu party of 40.   The manager accommodated us and did a great job keeping up with drinks and food for everyone. The view is amazing as it is outside on second floor overlooking Bellagio fountain and the strip.  They also have large cooling fans to keep us comfortable.   The macaroni egg rolls, hot wings, nachos, and skewers were all delicious. My favorite however was the hummus; fresh and not over processed.  We'll be back next year !

7kahmS7SZt4pd-Vup54_mQ.text: Came here because we bought a Groupon, excited about the location and the outdoor feel.   Decent service, however when we checked our tab the bill was $99 for 3 beers, the Backyard BBQ hotdog, the sausage dog and waffle cut fries. I don't know about you but $17 for a 22oz glass of beer is EXTREMELY overpriced.   For sure a tourist trap.  As locals we won't be coming back to this place.

DbgXgq7XHVBNaB06xN4-0g.text: I reluctantly came here for a Football Sunday, because for some reason I just assumed I would hate this place just given it's location on the strip I thought it would be full of weirdo tourists.  I cannot speak for a 'normal' day, but for football it is perfect.  The breakfast menu (1 p.m. ET games are at 10 a.m. PT, big adjustment for me) is pretty limited, but I really liked the Sausage and Egg on a Muffin sandwich.  The brisket and eggs was okay, potatoes/pepper/egg was good but brisket cuts were a little fatty and overcooked.  Fairly reasonable prices on drinks here, as you can imagine by the name the beer selection is very comprehensive (other than the fact Bud has a stranglehold on the domestic, so no Coors Light or Miller Lite here).  Staff was great, friendly waitress and a roaming 'water' guy always makes sure you are hydrated (great touch).  I had such a positive experience for Football that now I'd likely come back on at night to check out the scene.  Note: if you have a large crew or really need to watch your team, call ahead and reserve a table.

x9degVEeOZD46W1Lp5lggw.text: Beer park is one of my favorite go too's, whether as a local or traveling from out of town. Nicoli,Laura, Selena, Adam, Barrie and Alan make you feel like like family.  Food is phenominal (meatloaf sandi is reccommended), great beer selection, and a perfect atmosphere for people watching, the fountains of the belagio,or one of the many big screens for your favorite team....Go Raiders, Go Knights!

76gySScYPGQuhkoJU10vEw.text: After reading about this place in one of the Las Vegas weekly magazines, I was able to visit this place tonight. Located at the Paris Hotel underneath the fake ifel tower, it's a good place to chill day or night and nice views of the bellagio fountain water show.   Good choice of craft beers, lots of Jenga games, pool tables, beer pong, lots of tv's for viewing sports, and table soccer games. You can sit at the end and look down onto the strip and people and car watch.  My only -1 star is because it's the strip. The price of beers are like mlb baseball prices. A 32oz glass will cost you from $13-15 bucks depending on what beer you order. The 16oz is cheaper pending on the   The food menu is decent. I only had the blue cheese burger and tator tots. Both were good but not great. I don't know how the other foods are but I was told by the bar tender that all the burgers were good and the tator tots.   I would definitely come back again. The best time to come during the hot summer days is at night from 7:30 pm on. The best times are Friday and Saturday night because they open till 2am. The rest of the days they close at 11pm.   So of you ever decide to come here, just know that be prepared to spend more than you should. As far as the service, the bar tender was very tentative every time I  walked up to him and ordered a beer and food.

LveCwEkVYSqayiRnQyBOrA.text: I had an awesome time here great food love the atmosphere and Nicoley is the beat bartender ever !!!

yAYYMm1F4VFI979irBLeAQ.text: If you're staying at Paris, or even walking by this is a great place to get a drink and quick appetizer. And the deck has misters so it's a great place to cool down on a hot day! It's created by Budweiser, so expect only Budweiser beers such as shock top, bud light, hoegarden, etc.   Pros:  The fries with pulled pork and pretzel with beer cheese are delicious!

LEpb6QKCL9SY7pn8ZZDvSQ.text: Great outdoor place for a beer. We sat at the rail and people watched at 7:30 and it was shady, not too hot in the middle of summer, and they had misters. Great view of the Bellagio water show as well.   Good beer selection. My wife ordered wine and it was a generous pour. They have Jenga, Connect Four, and Foosball.   Also, a shout out to our waitress from South Lake Tahoe, she was great!

ufhGT5ArdWEmL3geqn-DGw.text: The beer is way overpriced. Decent selection however.   I got the pulled pork sandwich because it said it was slow smoked for 12hrs and had jalapeno slaw.  The slaw was regular with a single jalapeno slice on top.  The pork was dry and very little smoke flavor.  They put their BBQ sauce on it instead of on the side and it was not very good and definitely did not compliment the pork.  I also got a side of Buffalo onion rings.  Sounds like it could be delish but it failed badly.  Instead of blue cheese crumbles and buffalo sauce drizzle on them served with ranch or blue cheese on the side, they had some kind of crappy blue cheese dust on them served with a side of not very good hot sauce.  Much better places to eat, drink and watch a game than this place along the strip.

Wzgj4BmRbKfhfJe3OXE2cQ.text: This place has potential to be an amazing sports bar in Vegas however they need waYYYyyy better food! For the price the food is terrible! Why is the place named Beer Park and they do not serve normal buffalo wings?!! I was shocked!!  Redo the menu, get a Yardhouse type vibe, add a few more American beers on draft and you'll have 5 stars in my book!

IdOHs_XkqDMWhk0KGvebQg.text: We stopped in for a few appetizers and a couple of beers. The food was good and the service was too considering it was a busy Saturday night. I would normally have rated this experience 3 or maybe 4 stars. The problem was, and while I'll never return, was there was a "cnf" fee added to our check. I asked the server what it was and she said it was a fee "we charge our customers to come in and eat & drink here".  This fee is not mentioned on any signage that I saw nor did I see it on the menu. Just a random fee they apparently add on without warning. Ours was $3.05.    I have never heard of anything like this, even the hotels will advise you before hand of their "resort fee".  I hope they enjoy that $3.05, will never return.

Ai-mX4S7QxrL8YAJg5barQ.text: I enjoyed myself very much at this particular establishment yesterday, but today as I was greeted by a young lady at the entrance, I was offended in the fact that she said "just to let you know, there is a $35 minimum per person at the bar". There were 8 in my party. I would have paid her $50 per person to shut the f*** up and just get us some seats instead of offending us as if we were not planning to spending money there. Needless to say $35 is two good drinks at any bar in Vegas. HELLO!!! Maybe Beer Park should change the verbiage and train their employees to be more PC and less offensive/ judgmental. Needless to say we decided to spend our Sunday football drinking and eating money elsewhere.

35GCLT-Lbqm4eTv61wW8Dw.text: I made a reservation for the new Beer Park for late night for my 40th birthday thinking "ooh fun, we will get to watch the Bellagio fountains and drink beer and have fun". I was wrong.  Pluses: Not many. Smaller selection of beer than expected. Great ceramic red solo cups and plates. Good soft pretzels.   Minuses: Beer selection is mainly dark or Amber beers. Super hot up on the roof even at night. The cool air Misters blow right up into the air. Totally useless. The view of the Bellagio fountains? Non existent through shrubbery. Waitstaff was less than pleasant.   All in all, save your money. Drink for free in the casino.

ZVr69MMuftKWa_4CUrzpSw.text: Ask for Alexis!! Even after mixing up orders, She did all in her power to make things right, and the manager Jason was extremely kind and even offered us free drinks.

ivlDthKtxTG52GzOuqIvGQ.text: The atmosphere is fantastic also the beer is diverse.. I really liked the Pilsner glasses the Budweiser was served in. I wish they sold them I would by six.  The food was good too. Had cheesy tater tots, hot dog wrapped in bacon, pretzel with cheese sauce, garlic cheese fries.    And this is one thing that makes this place stand out above many others. The view of the Bellagio and Caesars across the street with the sunset is astounding! This really is a top-notch location.  Great addition to Paris Paris.

Sm75pnD8ANVjYx6yiRCFEg.text: Awesome environment! It's a restaurant and bar on roof top in Paris. With fake grass, misters, and fun games. Food and service was amazing :) we went when the sun is going down so he weather was perfect and the burgers and fries were top notch :)

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IStLnuL0S_DK-26GgsYT0A.text: I love this place. Amazing location to watch any game or fight, the service I received from my server Jasmine was great, and they have a great selection of food and beer. Can't wait to go back.

Y8PatvS-5juM1-moN8M-EA.text: Not a bad place. Would have expected more from a strip location than paper plates. Drinks are at premium price, double the "well and draft cost." Locally! Food is typical-bar fare. Nothing special

O2ZaOULU1iKClZfvnpNR2w.text: Service was a bit slow on our recent visit. My hot dog was not hot. Wouldn't say it was cold, but it sure wasn't hot of the grill.  Great view though!

gAf6ZkXAxi7vDYjg0GOCow.text: Had beer and an appetizer here. The beer selection isn't as great as you'd think it would be with the name "Beer Park" but it's not too bad. It's mostly specialty beers of the big brewers, rather than a lot of craft beer.  Our waffle fries with pulled pork were pretty good, but as much as I enjoyed the pulled pork I didn't like the cheese they had on them. I forget what it was, but I found it to have an odd taste.  Great view of the strip if you can grab the right seat.

zVBJG4G48y1Mz404_BXAyg.text: Specifically to my experience, atmosphere I give 5 stars, food 2.5, service 1.5.  Visiting for vacation and came here with my bf.  Love the vibe of this restaurant, its like outdoors, but also indoors, plays music, extra large games you can play while waiting for the food...very cool.  On to the service, I was confused, we had two different girls come to the table at different times so it was confusing which was actually our server.  The one we deemed as our official server was very mediocre with us in her service.  Anyways on to the food.  Chili Verde nachos: Saw all the mouthwatering pictures posted and all the amazing reviews.  I was fooled, I did not care for them.  My first bite, something was off, it just had this weird taste that I'm not used to nachos tasting like. So I'm like okay, maybe I got a bad taste, I'll go back for another, nope still the same off taste.  Then I realized it tasted like a hint a beer, which was causing the off taste, as I do not enjoy the taste of beer.  My boyfriend drinks beers here and there and he also didn't like these nachos. The cheese was very mute in flavor, didn't have the typical queso flavor, no tomatoes, lettuce, guac, sour cream.  Even the pork was weird, I think they should offer chicken or beef as an alternative.  Bleu Cheese Burger: This is what my bf got and it was pretty tasty, however the fries were an extra cost and way too much salt.

NUWtcnrQHtujaeEQvKj2fA.text: Great food, great atmosphere! Brittany was an excellent server!! Will definitely come back. Had an awesome time :)

DHptjgpxEPKdWrjw_GszvQ.text: Sat for 15 minutes No greeting No service, but they did manage to come by to steal my half full beer. Terrible establishment. Was told it was shift change hence the bad service, still no excuse.

5SOCNbV409d81DbdAV1TuQ.text: Food and drinks is overpriced and they also charge a "cnf" fee which for the life of me idk what it means it's nothing but just an excuse to charge more on top of the bill. The set up is real nice though, it overlooks the strip and they have a bunch of tv's perfect for watching the game. Just the price and unnecessary fees is what lowers the rating

1M5hhI7iHq5Td-vLWrScmg.text: Rachel the hostess was amazing she treated us like kings! Highly  recommend checking this place out next time you are in Vegas

N_U8i7X9JNu0Rbm4wKD6hg.text: Great place!! Great location!! Fun games!! Great atmosphere. Beers are a little pricey, but nothing shocking being new and center strip. Great view of fountains. Cannot wait to go back during the summer for sports.  Bottoms up!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside !! Second floor!!
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Views!!!!

JxaX8yINNNc-48kRZ3TbAw.text: Great view. After that, nothing good can be said. All Bud products on beer list and way overpriced. Service is lacking. Food options are limited and also overpriced even by Strip standards. Quality is not even close to being on par with the pricing. Last, but definitely not least, they hit you with a very sneaky deceptive 4.7% fee on every check. It's called a concession fee. A few other unscrupulous restaurants are doing this, like their sister property Hexx. You get absolutely nothing for this added, hidden fee. Yes it is on the menu, in tiny little print in the bottom corner located after a warning about meat products. Shame on you Beer Garden. Your great view isn't enough to get this person back.

fxWOlp5Y65GrrORQIQ5oqA.text: The atmosphere is like a fun backyard party. The crowd was really mixed - clearly some locals like us, as well as the standard out of town crowd. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. Lots of games to play around. We had a beer flight and a cocktail, and the wait staff brought us two mixed drinks (worth $24) on the house as well. The hot pretzel twist is so yummy with beer, and the quesadilla was yummy as well!

G3Q40Twr3h4SJSjtpmidPw.text: I love this place. I don't have the time to get there enough would be my only complaint. I have visited roughly 6, 7 times since they opened. Every time, a perfect experience. I love their bartenders, knowledgable, personable, sincere people (Courtney is their Beer Queen), SKY JACK MORGAN is the man, they have the best selection of beers on the strip, period. Plus they support local Nevada Craft which is important to me. Trust me, I will be back soon.

OX959O8mNk-KOlSPWByKtg.text: Nice seating area,  but way over priced.  $32 for a bucket of Michelob and the food is less than mediocre.  While it tastes fine, it is definitely preserved,  processed food.  Nachos use canned goods. A hamburger that is light used cheap meat and is $13 with no fries or anything else.   Don't go unless you like throwing money away. .

5QC5216VMPCgggxp7vl5NA.text: Visited for the second time and was very satisfied with both the food and the service.  Customer service, the ideal location, and a great selection of IPA's is what keeps me coming back.

M3y_Ro6ML-TkC6PPf3U4jw.text: Not bad for Vegas, but don't expect much.  Mostly Budweiser products and average food; a couple of local taps but you'll find a much better selection at the Public House in the Venetian or a TAG in the LINQ.  If you're looking for a place to sit outside and watch some sports, it's a pretty good spot.  The bartenders were friendly, so that bumps it to 3 stars.

Xh9F1_DTR2tYvN5DFInfHg.text: Food is pretty good. However they don't know where to seat people or whether or not the section your in has service or you need to walk up to the bar. They could really jump up service, training and organization and a star from everyone. Burgers are good. Avoid bland regular fries and get onion rings, Garlic or waffle fries. Great beer selection as well. Only service and training needs to be improved.

pFvhGmICcG0SeOW2IRXxmg.text: OMG I'm so full. Good bar food with a nice view of the strip. Great place for lunch with good friends.

aQMUUY5_zQk7CnZ3Tet4Ow.text: Atmosphere is awesome for sports lovers!! I was visiting and wanted to catch an east coast game,  i made reservations and they ask which game you want and arrange it for you.  I had a great spot with one of their big screens with my game on! The location is in the middle of the strip and convenient.  It is all outdoors and gets really hot.  The misters were on, but i was suffering a little.  The food tastes AMAZING! My only complaints are drink prices,  slow service and the fact that a football day was a blackout date for my groupon :( With it being a sports bar,  you would think that the groupon wouldn't be so limited,  not fair.  So,  i am out $26 because of that as im not going back to vegas before the expiration date!

WVF9bKOQ8mSak7EC1AIJPQ.text: Great atmosphere! Favorite bar on the strip. I love Jackie the bartender, excellent customer service!

AiZJlyO3ElxRDkRyd_mPhw.text: Awesome spot!! Great beer selection in the heart of the strip! Great to sit outside at night and eat and drink in front of the Bellagio fountains. Burgers are great and chili cheese nachos are phenomenal. Been here twice since it opened and I would recommend it to anyone! Awesome time!!!

0VZQfAMQQpDaYepp1Bfw4Q.text: We asked if they'd lower um tells, it's hot and sun is blinding us. We can't even look up to talk. Hosts said, "No , our manger she is refusing to lower umbrella". Walked off without letting us ask why. We are currently baking in the sun.  Hosts rude.

CmQnytKge9TLifed2zsMVA.text: View was beautiful and I enjoyed the roof top atmosphere. The food was absolutely horrid and the service was worse. If your into dried out awfully put together overpriced burgers with no sides your in the right Place. Our waitress could not have cared less about the service she was providing. It took almost an hour to get our ticket and refills on any drink were never going to happen. She added gratuity to the ticket which explains why she simply did not care about the service she provided. Horrible restaurant with a prime location.

Aml0ct4CStZ2F3e70Xyn9w.text: Like many other reviewers, I too think this is a very cool spot with a great vibe. Good beer, good food, love the games, and a perfect location. But, like a few other places, they have decided to trick their customers by attaching a 4.7% 'fee' to the bill without clearly indicating it anywhere. Clearly they don't trust that they're product is good enough to charge what they should, so they add this fee at the end, when most people won't even see it. It's an awful practice, and one that shows great disdain for the public. If you want to charge $18 for a drink, I'm fine with that, people can make their own decisions about value. But adding fake charges to bill is not ok.

vodQKihHYN8BusopiMJJIA.text: Beer Park is for sure our favorite place on The Strip to watch sports! My fiance and I watched the Super Bowl here once a few years ago, and have spent a few more Sundays here watching football since. It's such a good spot - great food, a huge beer and drinks selection, and it's cute and lets you be outdoors in the nice weather.   Yesterday my fiance and I came with my sister and her boyfriend for our second annual Vegas football trip, and other than spending way too much money here (mimosas are $12 a glass whaaat) it was a super fun day again lol. We all loved our food and our waitress was super sweet! She was really attentive no matter how busy things got, which was really awesome.   To eat yesterday my fiance and I both got the Breakfast Burger which was sooo delicious, I highly recommend it. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burger
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great views!

FXUrlgttL0Py1LbQaxSkHw.text: This place is really cool, but why do they close early? 2am on a Fri/Sat night is definitely too early for a bar right on the strip. Their butter cake is to die for! And the fake red Solo cups are really cool. This is a fun place to go both during the day and at night, and it has a great view, I just wish they stayed open until 4.

o6ieK-2ziXSMdHEX7wvIZA.text: The one star here is solely because of the ambiance of Beer Park. If it wasn't a cute and fun spot, I'd give it negative stars.   When my party of 13 young black women arrived at Beer Park it was like leaving Vegas and entering rural Alabama where black people are seen as often as palm trees, aka never! We were stared at as we walked through the restaurant and found space big enough for us all towards the back. We got settled and about 10 of us went to the bar to order. After sitting at the bar unacknowledged for at least 5 minutes, a white woman walked up to the bar and was promptly greeted by the bartender who had been ignoring us.   Now, as a bartender myself, I understand that it's better to take one small order before taking care of a large party. The problem was that 1) we all could've ordered before that woman even got to the bar 2) the bartender was VERY rude when we asked to order because we were there first.  Any other day, I would've left this bar immediately. However, being that we were all starving and had found a place large enough for our group we stuck it out and mostly ordered from a different bartender.   I ordered the grilled chicken btla which was a big disappointment. The chicken was rubbery and bland and it took about 20 minutes for me to get it. I was one of the first to order and several burgers and other items came before I got my sandwich. Other members of my party waited almost an hour before they received their food.   Overall, Beer Park is pretty trash. They're in a good spot with a great view but I'll never eat there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the rooftop
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer menu

rc8ELCULntla4drxomBwGw.text: Came here a while back to hang out for a few hours and it won't be the last. It's located upstairs which is great because you can people watch as well as watch the Bellagio fountain show once it comes on!  There is plenty of seating. When we got in we walked straight to the bar. I ordered a michelada which was okay and I can't remember how much it was but I know it was between $10-$15. I also got these quesadillas which were alright. They have a range of sauces for you which was an added bonus.   There were a few games at the table and we were playing connect four. Then we walked towards the pool tables. You have to give an ID to trade for the balls and stuff to play. Overall it was a fun experience and I would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F7nJbIuymotYcYtUMrNIFg.text: Chose this place for dinner for it's view and location in Paris and next to planet Hollywood. The view was amazing. One of the best you'll get for dinner. The food is pub food, decent priced. We got fries and salads but if I was feeling more hungry I could if done some serious damage. Our server was great as well and as it got dark we not only saw the fountains go off a few times but the Eiffel tower light up

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the strip
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Bellagio
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My meal

wfVhTSxNZpoQiariP5XBsg.text: Excellent food, view and service. This place makes me want to come back for more. They have beautiful outdoor seating right across from the Bellagio. There are also plenty of games to play here like a giant Jenga, pool, what do u meme etc... very cool Place.   Hubby loved his burger and I had the ahi tuna sandwich which was excellent. We also enjoyed the onion rings and loaded tots. They aren't stingy with anything either. Oh and they have real German style mustard on the tables that was amazing!!   This place is a must while walking the strip.

EXv2qGOBSuoAMQurdqW3YA.text: One of my new favorite spots in Vegas! Get reservations because I never saw this place with many open tables. We had a fantastic table for two with panaramic, unobstructed views of the Bellagio side of the strip. The vibe here is just cool, laid back, and party. My husband and I loved how the water came in glasses modeled after the solo cup and the tail gate look of the restaurant. They even had a variety of board/card games at various tables to play with!  The food and drinks are killer! We shared the mac and cheese eggrolls which were the perfect fun appetizer to share, and definitely utilize the dipping sauces it comes with! I got the BBQ Chicken Cobb salad and my husband got one of their burgers. The salad was huge and beautiful! I gave it an honest try but still had a lot leftover because there was just so much to it! We loved our drinks and would've ordered more if we weren't planning on having drinks at a different spot after lunch. My only issue was service was a little slow but we didn't so much mind because it was nice to sit back and admire the views.

OQh4SyD3SAiqeNHT4_SQfA.text: Food decent but expensive. It's Vegas...  Service... Horrible. Place is empty.. Go up and ask for a menu was told go to hostess station. I went there and she had to track down a server. She seemed irritated. Fast forward to getting my food. No drink. I said where is my drink? She rolled her eyes and had a dumb blank stare... Ice tea I reminded her. She went back to search for it I guess. 3 min later she emerges after having to stop and talk to a coworker first...because that's more important. I get the bill and this literally took 7 MIN to run my card. First I said bill to my room, she comes back 5 min later... I can't do that. Really? At this point Im beyond irritated. Hand her my card and it takes her a few minutes to run this... Apparently not the sharpest tool in the shed. I left a nice note and told her to show her manager. Last time I'll be at this place when I'm here for a conference. Doesnt seem they can find decent/competent people to work. Oh and yes.. They dress like hooters.. Some should not be wearing shorts so tight that you see butt cheeks hanging out. That in itself makes you loose your appetite.

pB0jrzvd0eoCLS_Jssbu4Q.text: The food was not that great. Had the breakfast burger and the meat was very dry. Also had the dirty fries and the meat and fries combination wasn't that good. Tried my friends loaded tots and those were good. The banana pudding made up for the food. That I will say was really good. Other than that expensive drinks and mediocre food. But when you're on the strip what do you expect?

jrqpKQ__TsCvRcWL9gB4Rg.text: Last weekend, my sister and her fiance, my boyfriend, and I came to Vegas for our second annual Vegas football trip lol. Both years we have gone to Beer Park to watch and bet on our games, and it's always a great time!! It's a great spot on the roof overlooking The Strip, and they have tons of TVs and seating for all of us to find our game. You'll definitely want to get there early to find a good spot, because it gets crowded on Sundays.   They have great mimosas and Bloody Mary's for the morning games, and a huge selection of beer to choose from during the day. We even had some seltzers, as those are available on their menu, too. My boyfriend had the Popcorn Chicken, and it was amazing. He did get the buffalo and bleu cheese on the side and just ate it plain - he was a little hungover and still getting going ;) but the chicken by itself was great! I had the Grilled Chicken B.L.T.A. and it was sooo good. The chicken was nice and juicy, with a really yummy bun and chipotle mayo. I would definitely recommend it. It's a really good brunch option for when it's actually getting closer to lunchtime.  My sister and her fiance both got the Breakfast Burger, which they went on and on about for days lol. It did look amazing and I'll probably try that if they still have it next time we're in town! Also, our waitress (wish I remembered her name) was awesome. Super nice and fun, and did a really great job. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled B.L.T.A.
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn Chicken
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa

vj8l8_DD4kJ6rElc4bWV3g.text: Had so much fun here that we came back three times during our short stay in Vegas!  Beer Park is a rooftop bar overlooking the Las Vegas strip. Totally the right place to watch a football game as they have multiple high-definition TV's. Tons of picnic tables to sit at along with games you can play such as jenga, connect four, and they even have baggo. With an extensive beer list you shouldn't have any problem finding something you like! They even have a beer cocktail list.   We came here last Sunday to watch the Eagles game. Because it was such a huge day for football they were only showing it on one tiny TV in the corner of the bar. Kind of stunk, but what can you do. Every bartender we interacted with was so nice and fast at their job. They card everyone. If you get a drink from one bartender they will card you and if you get a drink from their partner they will probably card you too.   The food here looks amazing. I was drooling over the nachos, but never got a chance to try them! - I recommend trying to get a seat that over looks the strip. So nice and relaxing and it's the perfect amount of breeze on a warm night. During the day they have awnings and mists to keep the crowd cool.   During the weekends they open up @9AM!

3f1QNToTwOHHz_aGegsknA.text: I love the outdoor environment of beer park! The view is one of the best in vegas, over looking the belagio fountains! The staff is fun, knowledgeable and super friendly!!

vchAhF-sp31qWA1aqZCqGg.text: If you want a great view of the Bellagio fountains, and sit above the crowd down on the Strip to see the Vegas sites, then the Beer Park is a place you must try.  Anheuser-Busch owns this loft style open air bar, with cooling fans, large screen TVs, and an assortment of Anheuser-Busch products.  The ambiance is great for someone wanting to see the Vegas sights and sounds outdoors and enjoy a brew at the same time.  The only negative thing I would say about this place is the price. A few beers will set you back the same as a normal dinner out in many cities. Three large drafts and tip will set you back about $40, but you're in Vegas and if you won big at the Bellagio or Caesars Palace come here for a nightcap!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

70BTNwByVQdceBM2fA3jVQ.text: This place was ok. We had reservations so we didn't have to wait. Great Budweiser selection on beers. They do t have dos xx. So my husband was kinda bored.. music was ok as well. Kind of empty when we were there which was July 5th

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers

dUy2KxqfgcVfq7ChGNDkXA.text: Food was good the view was great. The fries tasted better than the burger. Burger was good as well. Service was good too! They will get you in and out fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger with bacon, onion rings and waffles fries

5_mJTX0tbmXGGL2RmbhPKw.text: The staff was extremely friendly, and they were very accommodating with a couple of custom modifications to my order.  The steak salad was delicious.  Thank you.  If you're doing Keto, I had the steak salad, without the apples or candy pecans, and subbed ranch dressing for balsamic.  No problems with getting the correct order!

K2mXPiohLsozmOMHwb7bmw.text: Amazing spot for fun with friends or a day with the family. Overlooking the strip and across from the Bellagio fountains its prime location is already a reason to check it out  Watching sunday football, the UFC fight Saturday night or just trying to grab a drink with some fun games and an upbeat atmosphere....this is the place without a doubt!

BNNdDfbKHfD7ikMYMpFEtQ.text: The food was good and fresh. Entrees are overpriced for bar food, especially since it is A la carte. The sides are also overpriced. Beware a Soda is $6.25 and a bottled beer is $10.25. Your Bill will also have a bogus fee called a CNF fee tacked on plus tax.

15gtOy5B5MxYW-3ZNBgysg.text: Yummy drink  We got the biggest size mango with vodka  And it was really good I'll be back for a refill soon Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tQmSP2VYSLXZDoKFRE9x1Q.text: Great beer selection, friendly staff and an amazing menu! We loved the beer selection and felt the beer selection was amazing (see photos). Our group loved the sampler option of 4 smaller glasses to try more beers. Great place to visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rvWCE6a2vEjt-WwkxgKa-Q.text: Beer Park is a cool spot to get a drink on the strip with a great view of the Bellagio Fountains, but that's about it. Beers were really expensive (as to be expected on the strip, but still...) and for being called "Beer Park" they really didn't have a plethora of options (many options from the same brands, mostly national brands). I've been many places that feature more beers then this location.   There were some "lawn games" that you could play on the deck including a giant Connect 4. They also had some nice seating areas on the deck area.   The bartender we ordered from wasn't warm and fuzzy, but she got the job done and was able to serve us our drinks. I didn't see anyone receiving table service and was never offered a food menu so I'm not sure what the options are.   I'd stop by here again to check out the Bellagio fountains and maybe enjoy 1 drink, but then I'd head out somewhere else to explore.

N9DqBReAK7i_CCMaqNW-gw.text: This place is the best!! The food, the drinks, the view-It really doesn't get much better than this!!! The patio is literally right in front of the Bellagio foundations- it's incredible! The food was to die for! You have to try the smothered waffle fries!!!

7nDNkz39HzbFnArLUCAu9w.text: No. Just no.... I guess you could say I brought this on myself. What more could I expect out of a wannabe craft beer bar on The Strip?   I was prepared for high prices, but not this freaking high! I don't mind paying a pretty penny for a good quality beer. $15 for a pint of beer is a bit steep. I do however object to paying a significant premium for Budweiser's portfolio of "craft  beer". Heck, even Bud Light was $10 or something!   Being the sucker that I am, I ended up with a Founders Session IPA for $13.50 or something. I wasn't even close to drunk yet so that stung a bit more than the Vegas sun that was beating down my neck while sitting at the rooftop bar.    The rooftop bar with a killer view of the strip is a great idea. In fact it's the whole point of going here. It wasn't even all that hot on the day we were there and I couldn't imagine sitting out in the sun uncovered for much longer. If it weren't for all the beer splashing me from the frat dorks playing beer pong behind me, I would've overheated out there.   The service wasn't all that great to make me wanna come back either. I felt ignored for the majority of the time that we sat at the bar. That's okay because I ignored the line on the receipt where it says tip...  No thanks to any Budweiser swill. I'll stick to Sin City Brewing for all my beer needs until real craft beer eventually hits the strip. Or better yet, hitch a ride to downtown where there's a few decent breweries popping up lately.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $13.50 is bad enough for a beer. The added tax and fees is where I draw the line.

w9vmd7fqeTLdPksjPdlX2w.text: The waitresses are babes and the amazing view of the Bellaggio fountains is awesome too.... I love the game and the bathrooms are very clean but I personally think that $45 for two beers and a shot of peach schnapps is pricy even for the Las Vegas Blvd. I believe the locals should get a discount here as well cause it's pretty cool ....like so cool every time I have a friend in town I bring them here!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yjZxm8XKH3MopgPX62LUBA.text: Very poor service by the bar tenders. Extremely reluctant to fix drinks! When I asked for a vodka sprite minus the ice, the guy serves only a glass of sprite without any vodka. Would give this place 0 stars if yelp would allow.

KC4NU0ASaL05HlWjM5X5eQ.text: The Beer Park was a nice break from the typical Vegas dining experience. The food was not only reasonably priced, but delicious. I had the BBQ Burger and it was fantastic. The staff was wonderful, drinks were great, and the VIEW. The view was incredible. Front row seat for the Bellagio fountain.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SV3V5mx1uNDZ9ov0nXFzzw.text: When I walked into this place I immediately thought, "Alrighty... I now get why they call it Beer Park."  Just like your local community park, Beer Park is a completely outdoor venue with a playground of grown-up activities.  Big Jenga, big Connect-Four, bean bag toss, and pool tables are available to keep you busy while you take down your brew of choice, and they've got a huge selection of the draft and bottled variety.  While you can't grill your own BBQ as you would at the park down the street, Beer Park's got a pretty good food menu.  For me, I didn't dive into the entrees, but I can attest that the Chile Verde Nachos hit the spot.  For this location, Beer Park has probably one of the best spots on the strip; great spot to watch the Bellagio fountains.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taken from the entrance. There&#39;s only one, so if you&#39;re looking for it, find it here.
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

myLI44KdwbiXrAJg2y3liA.text: This place is a JOKE! Yes it's nice looking, and yes it has a great view of the Strip and Bellagio Fountains, but that's it folks!! Beers here are all owned by ABINBEV, so though there are a few craft beers available they fall under the ABINBEV Umbrella. And you pay a ridiculous price for said beers, and then on top of that a Vendor Fee is added as well. WTF? If you want to be viewed as a Hipster, and money is no object, then by all means feel free to stop in, But if you want to drink quality beer at much more reasonable prices, there are far better options in Vegas!

bPsuY4tXa2UZ2VUJuDsq_A.text: This used to be my all time favorite spot in Vegas. But Jesus Christ, during college football games it's sooo LOUD! You think I'm joking, but I'm not. It feels like your our drums are being blown out. And not just during the game - they also let the commercials blast at full volume unlike most sports bar who has a clever DJ who plays fun music during the breaks. I seriously hope beer park fixes this. Yikes.

5oWtl5y8SC0muujTk0KwRg.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.   I really like the venue and the amount of TVs, but the menu and prices were as expected. With the great real estate comes the lofty prices of beer. Even for a low level beer it will run you $9. The food is typical bar food and will also break your bank. They do have great TV selection and a shuffleboard table which is nice. Couple that with a great view and plenty of seats and I could see why you'd come here. But unless you just need to have that beer with a view, I think there are better options on the strip.

3UTINUdQqvdyhSk-OSmA6w.text: Teetering between 3 & 4 stars, so probably a 3.5. First off, it wasn't too busy and we were sat directly in the sun which was hot. We asked if we could go to a shadier table and had to wait because I think she may have needed to ask permission even though there were tons of empty tables. We really just didn't want to roast in the sun. I didn't really look at the menu before going in because we were hungry. There weren't too many healthy options on the menu and the portions were huge (which is usually a good thing). It was a cool area though with games on the tables and a good selection of beer. Pricing was okay to kind of pricey, but what can you expect when you are over looking the strip. Our waters weren't filled and when you order drinks, you want to stay hydrated. We weren't checked on as much I'd like (to ask for water, had to ask someone random working there). Maybe our waitress may not have liked that we wanted to switch tables? Service was not the best. Overall our food was decent, service was meh, and the best part may have been the games...

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked prime rib cheesesteak sandwich

69l8kgCquMFj7q3cpTrB4A.text: 4/5 stars for the beer selection and the TVs/sports aspect.  Newish sports bar type place OUTSIDE of the Paris hotel. They have TONS of big screens tuned to all the relevant games and lots of delicious beers on draft and bottled to choose from.  Food is overpriced and not anything special. I shared the carne Adana plate ($22) with my uncle and it was tough and lackluster. My parents said the salads were decent but it's $15-$20 bucks. Definitely skip it.  Another positive: they have a ton of games you can play for free (they hold your ID  while you're using it). They have a jumbo connect four you can play on your table, and my dad and I played shuffleboard while we waited for our food.  My advice? Skip the food. Come here for a beer (or 3) and to catch part of your game.  WARNING: they have misters but if you are in the sun/here not in the winter months or at night it will be HOT and miserable.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooo many games and sooo many beers

dzh4gMizJwHCUog0rRHdLQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to dine in Vegas! They have amazing service, tasty food and one of the best views in all of Vegas! Everything I've tried off their menu has been fantastic and the portions are filling. My favorites are the hummus platter, Ceasar's Salad and their homemade pickles. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is I feel their beer prices are a bit high, even for Vegas. My brother spent $15 for a Stella, my bf spent $14 for an IPA. I always get a bud if I come here, but only because that's the only $6 drink you can get. Because of that, I recommend coming for the food and atmosphere and getting a majority of your drinks elsewhere. Overall though, it's an amazing place to hang out!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious hummus plate.

J4P5c5yJrRBXNbMPpc6_rw.text: Great spot to hang out on a sunny day and enjoy a beer. Also the food was very good. The elevated view of the strip and the bellagio makes it seem removed from the chaos of the strip. It was a great place to start my first day in Vegas. Only 4 stars due to the overpriced beer, other than that it was a fun place to be on a nice day.

-niP7NPGpNt7jGqhKVs-7g.text: Warning: Beer Park is one of the places charging the CNF fee. AVOID! If you go to places that scam consumers with a CNF fee, all places in Vegas are going to start charging it.

yLJzerpcoqIPJJH029Dz5A.text: Jason the bartender put me at ease with those beautiful baby blues. Oh that chick Laura was amazing too. Beerpark is amazing-

xwKknxKZ8p__-IEaB1bAJA.text: The Beer Park located at the Paris on Las Vegas Boulevard right above the ARC Bar. The location is beautiful right across from the Bellagio. The ambience is great. You can see the fountains across the way and it's a prime view for people watching. They have booths and a couch area which look so comfy. We came on Friday the 30th at 7:00pm. So the reason for 3 stars is that the service here was insane. When you are in Las Vegas you think of fast friendly service and this place didn't cut it. Granted when things are busy you know it's going to be a while. I just didn't expect it to go down like this! We put our names down with the host for a booth/couch area. We decided to wait at the ledge overlooking the Strip. There were stools placed along the ledge. We sat for about 15 minutes and never had any body greet or talk to us. We decided to go to the bar and get drinks and return. We get to the bar and order a flight she immediately started making it before we could finish the rest of our order. We wanted a total of three flights and the bartender told us they were out of flights and had to wait until they washed more. Well at this point I'm already tired of waiting so we ordered cocktails instead. Then we went back to our area. Finally after 45 minutes of being there a server came and asked us if we wanted drinks. I said no we have someone getting us some can i just get a pretzel. The pretzel was a 10. Super hot and the cheese was yummy. It took a while to get that but I guess they were really busy. We wanted to order more food but our server never came back. After I got my pretzel another male server brought us waters, an hour into us being there. At this point we gave up on getting the couches and decided to go downstairs to the bar inside of the Paris. This place has so much potential but the service was the worst i have had in Las Vegas recently. I hate to say it because i love the concept! Maybe come when it's slow...

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UdUa1RDMVr5dWdxldNd_Yg.text: Umm, not sure why they have a 4 star rating to be honest.  It is not for the food, over priced bar food, soggy bacon, just passed the BBQ sauce bottle over the burger hockey puck.  Beer prices were 3 times the price as most venues next door At Planet Hollywood.  Service was few and far between.  Only reason I am giving them a single star is they do have a great view.

nIfkhr1Vl0CgMOfxTfKKFA.text: Great energy and service! It's a fun place to eat and drink. Staff was attentive too.

xIlJxSW1EtqV882mpSOE3g.text: Cool new spot on the Strip. A little confusing to find the entrance(s) to, but good times when you finally get there. Reminds me a lot of college where the cool kids hang out. Good music and good food.  Mac & Cheese Egg Rolls were killer. So many drink options too. Extensive menu all around.  I went with a big birthday group, and service was a little spotty, maybe because gratuity was already included. Not sure, but I'll be back anyway with 3 or 4 friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese Egg Rolls. 5/5

s_bPGj1K1cY_Y8CNTSrIjQ.text: Alyssa is the greatest super nice super amazing great host love her helped is quickly and made everything enjoyabke

W6miALdOWS4oXPLup0zMEA.text: This is our favorite spot to hang out right in the middle of the strip with amazing view of Bellagio and the strip. The Nachos chili verde is the best nachos ever with 4 kinds of cheese and sweet beer sauce and chunks of chiliverde meat. The service is good everytime we go. There is a place to play some games and there is a couch and some chairs. Its a nice place to hangout especially when the weather is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gtAy6Ci7afLL2G7OXPVcqQ.text: Cancelled my reservation I made a week in advance with a few hours notice. Not even an apology when I got phone call.

UWBWYtwgx9NiXcyDbNIg7w.text: Nicely situated across from the Bellagio Fountains and at the Paris Hotel. If you sit at the front you can watch the fountain show from here.  There are tons of TVs to watch football on; when I booked I was asked what game I wanted to watch. I had to change my reservation a few times and there was no problem with this and my table was still ready when I arrived.  The place has a fun atmosphere, there were people watching the football game while others were enjoying playing the games at their tables such as Jenga and Connect Four.  Menu had the usual sports bar selection of food. My BBQ Chicken Cobb Salad was a good size and tasted good. Was disappointed to hear they had run out of all their cocktails on draft when I went to order one. Also when we received the bill I discovered that they have a CNF charge that is known as the "Concession and Franchise Fee." That was an extra charge on our bill we weren't aware was going to be there. I think it's on really small print on their menu! I've only ever had a similar thing at Niagara Falls but after looking it up turns out a few restaurants in Vegas are starting it too!   The place is fun and food/location was good but shame about the extra fees!

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken Salad
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the Bellagio from Beer Park

C2qktrVQ2RgCJRgWqdkQ1w.text: Nice view. It gets warm when it's hot out. Only some tables have shade. They have a lot of Tvs. So it's good for a game. They offer games such as Jenga, or you can check them out at the hostess stand.

photos.caption: Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and chili cheese fries
Photo of Beer Park - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the bars
